alert.note: Alert for Livingston (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 23 at 4:35PM CDT until July 23 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN LIVINGSTON COUNTY... At 435 PM CDT, doppler radar indicated additional thunderstorm development, which may impact the warned area over the next 1 hour. This rainfall may lead to additional flooding. HAZARD...Flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Rapid-onset flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses, as well as other poor drainage and low lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Fairbury, Chatsworth, Forrest and Strawn. Up to 3 inches of rain fell previously over southern Livingston County. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
